result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah Marie Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah Marie Reynolds

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Leah Marie Reynolds
Current: 107 Lindoo Ave E, Ladysmith, WI 54848 United States  (Effective: 03-31-2022)
Prior: 317 Corbett Ave E, Ladysmith, WI 54848 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Leah Marie Reynolds
Current: 317 Corbett Ave E, Ladysmith, WI 54848 United States  (Effective: 03-31-2022)
Prior: 1111 Heart Island Pkwy, Rice Lake, WI 54868

01:32 PM Called 22CM32 for PLEAs, same appearances as previously noted. Defendant, Leah Marie Reynolds, appeared in person with Attorney Alysja Otten by video.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Court reviews right for all to be in person, def okay proceeding with Attny by video.  Def entered NG at INIT, wishes to change plea to G and accept ADA's offer.    Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Def was able to speak with Attny off the record about the offer.  Agreement was recited by ADA Schmidt at RWIN.
Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks if the PCS is mostly true, def confirms mostly true.  Attny Otten confirms the Court may use the PCS to find a factual basis.  Court asks if the def has any questions for the court or Attny before we proceed. Def has no questions.  Court asks for plea. 
Def enters a plea of Guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer and orders a JOC.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the Court.  Court finds agreement appropriate, had $250 paid originally but forfeited, however Judge has not signed and will amend that to not forfeit, and $300 more posted, so $550 on this case.

Court Orders: Fine of $500 inclusive of fines and fees, will return $50 to mailing address provided.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  May be expunged.

01:11 PM Called 22CM32 for RWIN. Defendant, Leah Marie Reynolds, appeared in person with Attorney Alysja Otten by video with approval of the court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State in person.  Return on WA and INIT, bail posted.    Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Attny didn't realize it was INIT too, has not gone over criminal complaint with def.  Def has not gotten a copy.  Court reviews criminal complaint and prints a copy for def. Court reads complaint charges and highlights PCS.  Def can read, write and understand English, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def updates contact info.  NG plea entered on her behalf.  Offer just sent & received for def to plead to obstruction for $500 as a fine inclusive of costs.  Def will call attny now to discuss offer. Court willing to go back on the record today to finalize this matter or schedule out.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

02:47 PM Attorney Alysja Otten in court.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def fails to appear.  Court reviews for service.  Atty Otten stands mute.  State requests warrant.  Court issues warrant, $300 cash, only judge may quash.  Court orders bond forfeited.
